intro: Racosperma burkittii, commonly known as the Burkitt's acacia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Racosperma burkittii is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various native fauna.
